node.title: Relief for netball fraternity as orange light move locked in
node.description: Confirmation of the move to the orange light setting comes as a relief to the country's top netballers - and the sports administrators.

node.title: Nurses, National critical of low success rate of $300,000 recruitment drive
node.description: An overseas recruitment campaign targeting ICU nurses has employed just three people since it was launched two months ago.

node.title: Food price rises: 'No matter how you cut it, it's clear that NZers are paying too much'
node.description: The annual food price rise announced today confirms the need to "rein in the super profits of the supermarket duopoly", Minister of Commerce and Consumer Affairs David Clark says. Audio

node.title: Hipkins slipping? Chagrin over mask rules mix-up
node.description: The calm, confident visage of Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins slipped into confusion and contrition over mask rules this afternoon.

node.title: Video of fatal police shooting of Black man in Grand Rapids released
node.description: Lyoya was shot in the head during a struggle in which he and the officer appeared to be fighting over the officer's Taser.

node.title: See how the U.S. is shipping javelins to Ukraine
node.description: CBS News was given an exclusive look at a shipment of U.S. military weapons bound for the battlefield.

node.title: McKinsey used its FDA work to consult with opioid makers: Report
node.description: The New York-based consulting firm had a "serious conflict of interest" with the arrangement, a congressional report found.

node.title: Allyson Felix announces retirement: "One last run"
node.description: Felix is the most decorated track and field athlete in Olympic history, with 11 Olympic medals.

node.title: Amazon hits sellers with 5% "fuel and inflation" fee
node.description: Online retailer says surcharge is needed to offset its rising labor costs and the cost of building more warehouses.

node.title: Barry Manilow tests positive for COVID, will miss Broadway show premiere
node.description: Manilow was scheduled to attend the opening nightâ€‹ of his new Broadway show "Harmony: A New Musical," but said he will miss it.

node.title: Mark Meadows removed from North Carolina voter rolls
node.description: North Carolina's attorney general and state bureau of investigations are looking into whether Meadows committed voter fraud in the 2020 election.

node.title: Two people in custody after early morning west Auckland stand-off
node.description: Armed police are at a house in west Auckland, the site of a brief standoff this morning.

node.title: East Coast weather: Workers clear roads in aftermath of storm
node.description: Contractors have been working since first light to clear roads on the East Coast where several state highways are blocked by fallen trees and flooding in the wake of Cyclone Fili. Audio

node.title: Rape "happening systematically" in Russian-occupied areas, Ukrainian lawmaker says
node.description: "Rape is used as a tool of war in Ukraine to break our spirits, to humiliate us and to show us that we can be helpless to protect our women and children and their bodies," lawmaker Kira Rudyk said.

node.title: Biden admin to change the way it deals with protesters near White House
node.description: Lawsuits by racial justice demonstrators removed from park near the White House in June 2020 prompted the change in policy.

node.title: Commercial crew in full stride aboard space station, , having "a ton of fun"
node.description: The mission commander and his three crewmates are plowing through a full slate of research and public outreach.

node.title: Mahuta disapproving of MPs' efforts to question Russian ambassador
node.description: The Foreign Affairs Minister has called MPs' efforts to haul the Russian ambassador before them for questioning "not very useful".

node.title: Hitting the right balance on defence spending
node.description: Some countries are increasing their defence budgets as the war in Ukraine rages on. The Detail looks at whether New Zealand needs to follow suit.

node.title: 'Working harder, doing long days' - Healthcare services coping in south as Covid-19 lingers
node.description: More than 1300 cases were recorded in the Southern DHB on Monday, just a few hundred off the Omicron peak, but those on the frontline say healthcare services are holding up. Audio

node.title: Caught in feud between Texas governor and Biden, migrants arrive in D.C.
node.description: Advocates said Texas Republican Gov. Greg Abbott is using migrants and asylum-seekers as political pawns by busing them to the nation's capital.

node.title: Moving to orange: 'We are quite divided in terms of risk'
node.description: Covid-19 restrictions for all of New Zealand will ease from midnight tonight but a leading epidemiologist says the country is divided in its risk.

node.title: California lawmaker pushes 32-hour workweek for big companies
node.description: Bill would make it the first state in the nation to adopt a four-day week for employees at bigger companies.

node.title: Southwest pilots' union raises safety concerns over fatigue
node.description: Pilots with the discount carrier are battling exhaustion due to poor scheduling, union officials say.

node.title: How to make summer travel plans that actually stick
node.description: Nervous that COVID-19 could again foil your vacation plans? Here are some tips for not getting burned.

node.title: US president accuses Putin of genocide in Ukraine
node.description: Joe Biden rails against "the horrible things that the Russians have done in Ukraine".

node.title: Maryland man with over 100 snakes in home died from snake bite
node.description: Officials found over 100 venomous and non-venomous snakes in the man's house, with the largest being a 14-foot Burmese python.

node.title: These retailers are rationing baby formula
node.description: In some states, more than half of baby formula products were out of stock, new data shows.

node.title: Actor Cuba Gooding Jr pleads guilty to forcible touching
node.description: The guilty plea came nearly three years after Gooding's arrest in the case.

node.title: "Operation Titanic": Government turns to satellite technology to detect icebergs
node.description: Over a 100 years after the sinking of the Titanic, the government is unveiling new technology to detect icebergs that may be hazardous to ships.

node.title: Kurt Cobain's "Smells Like Teen Spirit" guitar to be auctioned
node.description: A portion of the guitar's proceeds will be donated to the program "Kicking The Stigma," a national initiative to raise awareness about mental health disorders.
